p: Among the aboveground traits studied, all of them depended on species identity and were negligibly affected by the tree biomass ( Table 1 and Supplementary Material 3). Four out of the 15 above- and belowground traits measured were significantly affected by earthworm presence. Although earthworm presence did not affect the shoot:root ratio ( Figure 3), nor the proportion of flowering individuals and number of ramets ( Figure 4) and the nutrient content of the plants ( Figure 5), it induced changes in the plant height, leaf ( Figure 3) and roots traits ( Figure 6).
